definition: rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]

sentences.english: Strictly prohibit landlords and rich peasants from sneaking into the peasant associations and poor peasant leagues.
sentences.chinese: 严禁地主富农分子混入农民协会和贫农团。

sentences.english: His master was a rich farmer in Brobdingnag , the land of the giants.
sentences.chinese: 他的主人是柏汀南巨人国的富农。

sentences.english: Build up a country adopting then hereafter, putting the policy preserving a rich peasant's into practice.
sentences.chinese: 建国以后，则采取实行保存富农的政策。

sentences.english: The third part is mainly rich peasants economic theory and policy.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分主要是富农经济理论和政策。

sentences.english: What is his attitude to kulaks here?
sentences.chinese: 这里他对富农的立场是什么？

sentences.english: They feel that neither equal distribution nor distribution according to labour power is to their advantage.
sentences.chinese: 富农觉得平均分和按劳动力分两种方法都于他们不利。

definition: land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
social composition/social status (in Marxist theory, esp. using during the Cultural Revolution)

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
